Though unsettling to see violence escalating in Egypt, Mr. Colin Powell suggested the events unfolding in the region are not surprising. People want jobs and they want better lives for their kids. The autocratic governments[ in the Middle East] have not been giving that to them and those governments are now at risk, he said. Mr. Colin Powell warned that the outcome of events in the Middle East is unlikely to benefit the United States. NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell presented the Pete Roselle trophy to him this morning. After accepting it, Aaron Rodgers talked about the journey that led him to the Super Bowl and a Championship win. Finally getting an opportunity and making the most of it, and this was another opportunity last night, they don't come around that often, i just wanted to make the most of it, we did as a team, a great team win, a great group of guys in the locker room, just really excited to be a part of it, said Aaron Rodgers . 2 days of protests in Egypt Zahi Hawass said now that the Egyptian Museum's collection is secure from thieves, the greatest threat to the collection inside is posed by the torched ruling party headquarters building next door. What scares me is that if this building is destroyed, it will fall over the museum, Zahi Hawass said as he watched fire trucks spray water on the still smoldering NDP headquarters.
